paper_title: The nonlocal advection diffusion equation and the two-slit experiment in quantum mechanics
abstract: A partial differential equation model is analyzed for the two-slit experiment of quantum mechanics. The state variable of the equation is the probability density function of particle positions. The equation has a diffusion term corresponding to the random movement of particles, and a nonlocal advection term corresponding to the movement of particles in the transverse direction perpendicular to their forward movement. The model is compared to the Schr√∂dinger equation model of the experiment. The model supports the ensemble interpretation of quantum mechanics.
